1.title: House of Radio with Kitty!
1.plot: Kitty interviews Patrick Estrada host/creator of GeekSpeakTV and Matthew Solomon, screenwriter. They discuss geek subjects from Star Wars, Star Trek, outing Kitty as a Trekkie! Patrick talks about his Harry Potter improv troupe and the conversation spirals out to comedy, fashion, cosplay. Matthew also speaks about his new film Chatter and his book Science Fiction Movie Classics, the First 40 Science Fiction Films. Introducing a brand new segment 'Turkey Talk' with Mike the Turkey in New York City!

2.title: Spy Me to the Moon
2.plot: Kitty and Patrick talk about all things AlleyCat including spy pens, hipsters, and opera! Piper the Cat makes his film debut and Kitty explains the Stride of Pride.

3.title: Comin' Down the Pipe
3.plot: Kitty interviews actress Alexis Iacono who speaks about her voiceover work, upcoming films, and her hatred of Kermit!!??! Alexis is a recognized voice in World of Warcraft, an actress in a few horror films including Dead Sea and The Black Dahlia Haunting. They discuss their new partnership producing the upcoming film The Pipeline.

4.title: Comedically Yours
4.plot: Kitty interviews fellow comedians Alex Phillipz and Virginia Collins. They discuss catface, Star Trek, standup comedy and surviving the dating world in Los Angeles. Virginia talks about writing jokes, ghostwriting for some big comedy cats and her standup style. Alex speaks about his reality show work on Are You The One?

5.title: The 90's Live On!
5.plot: Kitty interviews Los Angeles locals who help taste-make the industry. Rob Gross is the US marketing director of the Indie Music label Dine-Alone Records. Erica Hill is a "celebrity" chef in the making. All three folks have a deep passion for great music, great food and the 90's.

7.title: Revenge of the Geeks
7.plot: Kitty and Patrick cohost again and talk about Kitty's Kickstarter campaign for her film The Pipeline, international cat love and all things geek of course. Patrick is the host/creator of GeekSpeakTV on XMLA.

8.title: Do It the Write Way
8.plot: Kitty interviews esteemed colleague and a head of the UCLA Extension Writer's Program, Chae Ko. Chae discusses with Kitty how to delve into the world of screenwriting and the best ways into storytelling in Hollywood. Professionals like Phil Kellard, Chris Webb, Margaret Oberman and Kevin Kelton among many more are working screenwriters and also instructors in the world-famous writing program at UCLA.

10.title: So Three Italians and an Accordian Walk Into a Studio
10.plot: Kitty nerds out music style with special guests Shawn Clement and Cory Pesaturo. Shawn is an accomplished Hollywood film composer who plays so many genres it will make your head spin. Cory is a niche musician as a world-famous accordianist! These three talk about music, the writing process, and Shawn's nominations including the 2014 Hollywood Music in Media awards.

1.title: Battling the Glass!
1.plot: Kitty interviews the band members of the local Los Angeles band, Glass Battles. They talk about music, recording, doing music with Kitty, and shows all over including SXSW and touring.

2.title: Kickstartin It with 5SecondFilms!
2.plot: Kitty interviews Paul Prado and Mike James from 5SecondFilms on The AlleyCat Hour Season 1. They speak about the evolution of their short-form comedy brilliance and their upcoming DudeBro Massacre 3 film funded via Kickstarter.

3.title: Kitt-ernational!
3.plot: Kitty speaks with international guests Serena Lorien and Annabel Osborne. Serena is a British actress who has since gotten her US citizenship. Serena and Kitty were costars in the biopic thriller House of Manson. Annabel is a screenwriter from Australia. Annabel and Caitlin met at a film festival and are both screenwriters.

4.title: Kitty & the Dude!
4.plot: Kitty interview Jeff "The Dude" Dowd on The AlleyCat Hour on XsiteRadio XMLA! Jeff is the original dude upon which the Coen Brothers based the movie The Big Lebowski about Jeff Lebowski played by Jeff Bridges. The conversation branches up and away about film, creativity, activism, romance and all things Dude. Special Thanks to Emily Sketlon for Transpo and to the creators of Fingertip Maestro.

8.title: Compose Yourself!
8.plot: Kitty interviews the fantastic composer David Raiklen. David's compositions have accompanied amazing films and David and Kitty discuss music, science fiction and marrying music to film! Also with GeekSpeakTV host and creator Patrick Estrada and the graphics wiz-kid Mark Thornton!

10.title: Get Your Whang Out!
10.plot: Kitty interviews guests including comedienne Suzanne Whang and Indira Rojas, Miss Nicaragua International 2010 and Reyna Khalil, makeup artist to the stars. We discuss comedy, punk music and women in the arts and just about everything else!

12.title: Park It Right Here... And Rock Out, Please!
12.plot: Kitty interviews the amazing theatre director Pete Parkin and rehashes some old acting class work. Pete shares a story about the illustrious Tom Selleck during his pre-acting days at LAVC and sends Kitty into a spin. Also with Dori Cameron, founder and editor of STRAPPEDzine and member of the rock girl choir The Jezebelles. Dori talks about recording with Mike Cosgrove of the punk band Alien Ant Farm and spills the beans on Kitty's day job of voice instructing and conducting!

13.title: Drummin' Up Business
13.plot: Kitty interview the unbelievably talented drummer and musician Franklin Vanderbilt. Franklin discusses life as a drummer, his Ludwig sponsorship and being on the road with Lenny Kravitz. He also announces his solo music project and gives Kitty some special first listens to some studio tracks!
